docs.snippet: The Indianapolis Colts have waived safety John Boyett a day after he was arrested on public intoxication and other charges....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Indianapolis Colts have waived safety John Boyett a day after he was arrested on public intoxication and other charges.

headline.main: Colts Waive Rookie Boyett Day After Arrest
headline.print_headline: Colts Waive Rookie Boyett Day After Arrest

docs.snippet: Three suburban Boston high school soccer players used a broomstick to rape one freshman boy and try to rape two others last week at a sports team-building retreat in western Massachusetts, a prosecutor said Tuesday. One was held pending a hearing ...
docs.lead_paragraph: Three suburban Boston high school soccer players used a broomstick to rape one freshman boy and try to rape two others last week at a sports team-building retreat in western Massachusetts, a prosecutor said Tuesday. One was held pending a hearing to determine whether he is a danger to the public.

headline.main: Prosecutor: Broomstick Used in Mass. Camp Assaults
headline.print_headline: Prosecutor: Broomstick Used in Mass. Camp Assaults

docs.snippet: FIFA president Sepp Blatter said on Tuesday he was powerless to stop transfer fees from rocketing following the world record fee of 100 million euros (84 million pounds) paid by Real Madrid for Welsh winger Gareth Bale....
docs.lead_paragraph: FIFA president Sepp Blatter said on Tuesday he was powerless to stop transfer fees from rocketing following the world record fee of 100 million euros (84 million pounds) paid by Real Madrid for Welsh winger Gareth Bale.

headline.main: Blatter Powerless to Stop Transfer Fees Soaring
headline.print_headline: Blatter Powerless to Stop Transfer Fees Soaring

docs.snippet: A monthlong standoff that prevented millions of viewers from watching hit shows like "Under the Dome" and "NCIS" — and threatened to interfere with the start of football season — ended Monday after Time Warner Cable and CBS Corp. resol...
docs.lead_paragraph: A monthlong standoff that prevented millions of viewers from watching hit shows like "Under the Dome" and "NCIS" — and threatened to interfere with the start of football season — ended Monday after Time Warner Cable and CBS Corp. resolved a programming dispute.

headline.main: CBS, Time Warner Deal Ends NY, LA, Dallas Blackout
headline.print_headline: CBS, Time Warner Deal Ends NY, LA, Dallas Blackout

docs.snippet: Kareem Copeland, who has covered the Green Bay Packers and college football in Mississippi, is joining The Associated Press in its Tallahassee bureau to cover Florida State University sports and state government....
